page.title: 11TRADE
page.content: Southminster is served by 34 retail {shops}with 21 different types of businesses. There are three small {supermarkets}which have increased their trade over the last three years. The shopkeepers obtain their{supplies from a wide area of England, the furthest being{Darlington}which is some 275 miles away. Many use large warehouses in{London}and collect their own goods. There is a{Farm Shop}which sells home-grown vegetables and locally grown apples pears and soft fruit. {Younger family shoppers}tend to travel once a week, fortnight or month to a large{supermarket}12 miles away at South{Woodham Ferrers}to do their shopping.{The Senior Citizens}use the local shops and shop more frequently. Once a week shoppers are bussed in from outlying areas.
